body:
@MislavSag thank you for reporting this issue.

It is also described in Issue #341 and will be fixed in the soon future.

issue.title: Fix MlFinLab issues

repository.name: mlfinlab
repository.description: MlFinLab helps portfolio managers and traders who want to leverage the power of machine learning by providing reproducible, interpretable, and easy to use tools.

issue.body:
# Description

In this PR the following issues are fixed:
 
Fixes PR #245 (needed to fix conflicts)
- Fix typo in fracdiff docstrings.

Fixes PR #311 (build wasn't passing)
- Improves the processing speed of Entropy Features from issue #198 by making the function _match_length() compatible with Numba.

Fixes Issues #341 and #405 
- Fixes Error in ONC caused by precision errors (the main diagonal of the correlation matrix was slightly higher than 1, so the distance matrix couldn't be calculated).

Fixes issue #403 
- Moves all labeling techniques in docs to the separate folder.

Fixes PR #418  (build wasn't passing)
- ONC code example is now simpler.

## Type of change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] This change requires a documentation update

# How Has This Been Tested?

All previous unit tests pass with no issues.

**Test Configuration**:
* Windows 10
* PyCharm


# Checklist:

- [x] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [x] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [x] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [x] My changes generate no new warnings
- [x] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [x] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [x] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

body:
This issue was caused by precision errors in the ONC module (the main diagonal of the correlation matrix was slightly higher than 1, so the distance matrix couldn't be calculated).

This issue is now fixed in PR #412
@PanPip Should I install from github or I have to wait for new release to try the function again?

@MislavSag It will be pushed to the `develop` branch at the end of the week and then soon to `master`.

To try it now you can install a local version from the `fix_issues` branch. We'll try to push it to `master` as soon as we can.
Ok, I will wait to be added to the master.
I tried to copy-paste functions from develop branch and execute, but still get the same error?

@MislavSag Thanks.

It's again due to numerical errors, but now for values not on the main diagonal of the correlation matrix. I'll fix it.

In your dataset these pairs of values are perfectly correlated:
`RSI30 - CMO30`
`RSI480 - CMO480`
`RSI2400 - CMO2400`

You can remove them and the function will work without any problems.

A quick fix, for now, would be to replace line **62** in `mlfinlab/clustering/onc.py`

from
`np.fill_diagonal(corr_mat.values, 1)`

to
`corr_mat[corr_mat > 1] = 1`
Fun fact, Pandas correlation function output can be > 1. I'll report this issue.

issue.title: Feature clusters update

repository.name: mlfinlab
repository.description: MlFinLab helps portfolio managers and traders who want to leverage the power of machine learning by providing reproducible, interpretable, and easy to use tools.

issue.body:
# Description

This PR changes feature clusters to use defined codependence to check for low silhouette scores. Previously Pearson's correlation was used for all codependence inputs.

It also fixes numerical errors in codependence matrices:
Fixes #405 

## Type of change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)

# How Has This Been Tested?

The unit test was updated to test results for `information_variation`, `mutual_information`, `distance_correlation` codepencence inputs.

- [x] test_feature_clusters.py 

**Test Configuration**:
* Windows 10
* PyCharm

# Checklist:

- [x] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [x] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [x] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [x] My changes generate no new warnings
- [x] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [x] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [x] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

body:
This Issue is closed in PR #421.

@MislavSag I've tested it specifically on your dataset. Just change `linkage_method='singular'` to `linkage_method='single'`
